title: Sources
text:
The data utilized in this project is sourced from the following references::

Average test score in mathematics and science vs. GDP per capita, 2016
Education Rankings by Country 2023
Average IQ by Country 2023

We integrated the datasets by performing inner joins based on the shared country identifier, and through careful data preprocessing (including data cleaning, column selection, renaming, and handling missing values), we were able to create a consolidated dataset that enabled us to explore the relationship between IQ, test scores, and education ranking at the country level.

title: Models
text:
We develop a linear regression model for each plot using the lm() function built into R. We then find Pearson’s correlation coefficient to measure the strength of the relationship between our variables of interest.
\(y_i = \beta_0 + \beta_1X_i + \epsilon_i\)



Call:
lm(formula = rank2021 ~ score, data = mergedData)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-29.939 -11.376  -3.007  11.082  30.579 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept) 128.6747    16.1218   7.981 1.06e-10 ***
score        -0.2128     0.0349  -6.098 1.19e-07 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 15 on 54 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.4078,    Adjusted R-squared:  0.3968 
F-statistic: 37.19 on 1 and 54 DF,  p-value: 1.187e-07

title: About
text:
My name is Rishi Sandrana and I am a rising senior at Walter Payton College Prep. Feel free to take a look at my GitHub and contact me at rishi.sandrana@gmail.com for any questions.
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp.

title: Home
text: The goal of this project is to analyze the relationship between test scores, IQ, and education ranking across different countries. We observe a strong positive linear association between a country’s average IQ and its average test scores in math and science, indicating a perfect positive relationship. Additionally, we observe a moderate positive linear relationship between a country’s average test scores and its education ranking, as well as between a country’s average IQ and its education ranking. It is worth noting that despite the decreasing trend of the line of best fit, countries with higher education rankings have lower values on the y-axis.
